com.github.privacystreams.core

Class MStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.privacystreams.core.Stream
      • com.github.privacystreams.core.MStream

  • public class MStream
extends Stream
    The interface of MStream (multi-item stream). An MStreamInterface is a stream containing many items, and each item is an instance of Item. An MStreamInterface is produced by uqi.getData method.
    See Also:
    It can be transformed to another MStreamInterface by transformation functions, such as {@link #filter(String, Object)}, {{@link #groupBy(String)}}, {{@link #map(Function)}}, etc. It can also be transformed to an ISingleItemProvider by transformation functions, such as {{@link #getFirst()}}, {{@link #getItemAt(int)}}, etc. Finally, it can be outputted using {{@link #asList()}}, {{@link #count()}}, etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      • filter

        public MStream filter(Function<Item,java.lang.Boolean> predicate)
        Filter the stream by testing an item with a predicate. Specifically, keep the items that satisfy the predicate. Eg. filter(eq("x", 100)) will keep the items whose x field is equal to 100.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to test the item
        Returns:
        The filtered stream.

      • filter

        public <TValue> MStream filter(java.lang.String fieldName,
                               TValue fieldValue)
        Filter the stream by checking whether a field equals a value. Specifically, keep the items in which the field equals the given value. Eg. filter("x", 100) will keep the items whose x field is equal to 100.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of field to compare
        fieldValue - the value to compare with the field
        Returns:
        The filtered stream.

      • limit

        public MStream limit(Function<Item,java.lang.Boolean> predicate)
        Limit the stream by testing each item with a predicate. Specifically, keep the stream as long as the predicate holds. Eg. limit(eq("x", 100)) will keep all items in the stream as long as x field equals to 100, once an item's x value is not equal to 100, the stream stops.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to test the field
        Returns:
        The limited stream.

      • limit

        public MStream limit(int maxCount)
        Limit the stream with a max number of items. Specifically, stop the stream if the count of items exceeds the threshold. Eg. limit(10) will limit the stream to at most 10 items
        Parameters:
        maxCount - the max number of items
        Returns:
        The limited stream.

      • timeout

        public MStream timeout(long timeoutMilliseconds)
        Limit the stream with a timeout, stop the stream after some time. Eg. timeout(Duration.seconds(10)) will limit the stream to at most 10 seconds
        Parameters:
        timeoutMilliseconds - the timeout millis seconds
        Returns:
        The limited stream.

      • map

        public MStream map(Function<Item,Item> function)
        Convert each item in the stream with a function. Eg. map(ItemOperators.setField("x", 10)) will set the "x" field of each item to 10 in the stream.
        Parameters:
        function - the function to convert the item
        Returns:
        The stream with items after mapping

      • project

        public MStream project(java.lang.String... fieldsToInclude)
        Project each item by including some fields. Other fields will be removed. Eg. project("name", "email") will only keep the "name" and "email" field in each item.
        Parameters:
        fieldsToInclude - the fields to include
        Returns:
        The stream with items after projection

      • setField

        public <TValue> MStream setField(java.lang.String fieldToSet,
                                 Function<Item,TValue> functionToComputeValue)
        Set a field to a new value for each item in the stream. The value is computed with a function that take the item as input. Eg. setField("x", Comparators.gt("y", 10)) will set a new boolean field "x" to each item, which indicates whether the "y" field is greater than 10.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - the type of the new field value
        Parameters:
        fieldToSet - the name of the field to set, it can be a new name or an existing name.
        functionToComputeValue - the function to compute the new field value
        Returns:
        the stream of items with the new field set

      • setGroupField

        public <TValue> MStream setGroupField(java.lang.String fieldToSet,
                                      Function<java.util.List<Item>,TValue> subStreamFunction)
        Set a field to a new value for each item in the stream. This transformation can only be used after invoking group methods (groupBy(String), localGroupBy(String)). The value is computed with a function that takes the grouped items as input at runtime. Eg. setGroupField("count", Statistic.count()) will set a new field "count" to each item, which represents the number of items in the grouped sub stream.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - the type of the new field value
        Parameters:
        fieldToSet - the name of the field to set, it can be a new name or an existing name.
        subStreamFunction - the function to compute the new field value, which takes the grouped items as input.
        Returns:
        the stream of items with the new field set

      • setIndependentField

        public <TValue> MStream setIndependentField(java.lang.String fieldToSet,
                                            Function<java.lang.Void,TValue> valueGenerator)
        Set the value of a new field with a value generator function. The value generator function is independent from current item, which does not need a input (input type is Void). The value generator will be evaluated on demand at runtime. Eg. `setIndependentField("time", TimeOperators.getCurrentTime())` will set the field "time" to a timestamp in each item; `setIndependentField("wifiStatus", DeviceOperators.isWifiConnected())` will set the field "wifiStatus" to a boolean indicating whether wifi is connected in each item.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - the type of the new field value.
        Parameters:
        fieldToSet - the name of the field to set, it can be a new name or an existing name.
        valueGenerator - the function to compute the field value.
        Returns:
        the stream of items with the new field set

      • sortBy

        public MStream sortBy(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Sort the items according to the value of a field, in ascending order. Eg. sortBy("timestamp") will sort the items in the stream by timestamp field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field used to reorder the stream, in ascending order
        Returns:
        The sorted stream

      • shuffle

        public MStream shuffle()
        Shuffle the items. shuffle() will randomize the order of the items in the stream.
        Returns:
        The shuffled stream

      • reverse

        public MStream reverse()
        Reverse the order of items reverse() will reverse the order of the items in the stream.
        Returns:
        The reversed stream

      • groupBy

        public MStream groupBy(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Group the items according to a field. Eg. groupBy("x") will group the items with same "x" field
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field used to reorder the stream
        Returns:
        The grouped stream

      • localGroupBy

        public MStream localGroupBy(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Group the contiguous items according to a field. eg. localGroupBy("x") will group the contiguous items with same "x" field
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field used to reorder the stream
        Returns:
        The grouped stream

      • output

        public <Tout> void output(Function<java.util.List<Item>,Tout> itemsCollector,
                          Callback<Tout> resultHandler)
        Output the items in the stream with a function to a callback. This method will not be blocked. Eg. outputItems(Statistic.count(), new Callback(){...}) will count the number of items and callback with the number.
        Type Parameters:
        Tout - the type of the result
        Parameters:
        itemsCollector - the function used to output current stream
        resultHandler - the function to handle the result

      • output

        public <Tout> Tout output(Function<java.util.List<Item>,Tout> itemsCollector)
                   throws PSException
        Output the items in the stream with a function. This method will block until the result returns. Eg. outputItems(Statistic.count()) will output the number of items.
        Type Parameters:
        Tout - the type of the result
        Parameters:
        itemsCollector - the function used to output current stream
        Returns:
        the result
        Throws:
        PSException - if failed to the result.

      • getValueGenerator

        public <Tout> Function<java.lang.Void,Tout> getValueGenerator(Function<MStream,Tout> streamOutputFunction)
        Get a value generator that can be evaluated on demand. The generator will not be evaluated immediately, instead, it will be evaluated once `apply()` is called.
        Returns:
        the value generator
